critique: This document pertains to the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933 and its application to the Lace Manufacturing Industry. It reflects President Roosevelt's approval of amendments to the Code of Fair Competition for the industry. The document indicates a strong role for the federal government in regulating the economy during the Great Depression. There is no information related to immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. Therefore, those axes should be scored as neutral. The document reflects a liberal approach to economic regulation at the time, with the government actively intervening in the economy to promote recovery.
